4247B4333B274C609F09AF17E9A48B9B.description: Revise and edit as necessary, using an established style guide.

A0E0CBBFA9414DE38F96E5006705B064.description: Write stories/scripts that have a clear beginning/middle/end; utilize effective and creative leads, strong transitional devices and tags, the 5 W's and 1 H (who, what, when, where, why, and how) and a variety of elaboration techniques and details.

B739679AB9BC4E7FAEEE89BEBA54B1C4.description: Write objective news, features, and sports stories that demonstrate solid journalistic practices in organization, tone, style, clarity, and focus. Utilize valid persuasive strategies in opinion and support judgments with substantial evidence.

367E57FD3B114A04BA4B03EE7D7932E6.description: Demonstrate control of grammar, diction, sentence and paragraph structure, punctuation, capitalization, spelling, and correct English usage.

4D10134F9B7D4AAF917AF4520FA578C7.description: Understand that a broadcast image or printed material is a historical record. It is the responsibility of the broadcast journalist to depict reality without manipulation and without being out of context.
